title: Data Types Deep Dive
reading_content:
Understanding Python Data Types

Python has several built-in data types that are essential for programming. Each type serves a specific purpose and has unique characteristics.

Numeric Types:

# Integer (int) - Whole numbers
age = 25
temperature = -10
big_number = 1000000

# Float - Decimal numbers
pi = 3.14159
price = 19.99
scientific = 2.5e-4  # 0.00025

# Complex - Complex numbers
complex_num = 3 + 4j

Boolean Type:

# Boolean (bool) - True or False
is_student = True
has_license = False
is_adult = age >= 18  # Comparison returns boolean

Sequence Types:

# String (str) - Text data
name = "Alice"
message = 'Hello, World!'
multiline = '''This is
a multiline
string'''

# List - Ordered, mutable collection
fruits = ['apple', 'banana', 'cherry']
numbers = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]
mixed = [1, 'hello', 3.14, True]

# Tuple - Ordered, immutable collection
coordinates = (10, 20)
rgb = (255, 128, 0)

Mapping Type:

# Dictionary (dict) - Key-value pairs
person = {
    'name': 'John',
    'age': 30,
    'city': 'New York'
}

Type Checking and Conversion:

# Check type
print(type(42))        # <class 'int'>
print(type(3.14))      # <class 'float'>
print(type('hello'))   # <class 'str'>

# Type conversion
num_str = '123'
num_int = int(num_str)  # Convert to integer
num_float = float(num_str)  # Convert to float
int_str = str(456)  # Convert to string

Type Characteristics:

  • Mutable: Can be changed after creation (list, dict, set)
  • Immutable: Cannot be changed after creation (int, float, str, tuple)
  • Ordered: Items maintain their position (list, tuple, str)
  • Unordered: No guaranteed order (dict, set)
starter_code:
# Create variables of different types and print their types
# 1. Create an integer variable 'age' with value 25
# 2. Create a float variable 'height' with value 5.9
# 3. Create a string variable 'name' with your name
# 4. Create a boolean variable 'is_student' with value True
# 5. Print the type of each variable using type()
solution_code:
age = 25
height = 5.9
name = "Alice"
is_student = True

print(type(age))
print(type(height))
print(type(name))
print(type(is_student))
